title: Untitled #86 (The Teen Tour)
transcript:
Woman 1: Young Chicago Authors, YCA is an organization that cultivates young voices through writing, publishing and performance education. The poem you're about to hear was written by a YCA poet as response to a work of art in our collection. Please be advised the stuff includes some mature content and may not be appropriate for all listeners.

Kee Stein: My name is Kee Stein and I'm a former competitor in Chicago's Louder Than A Bomb and an emerging teaching artist. The title of this piece is "After" in reaction to Cindy Sherman's "Untitled Number 86."

"I consider astral projection, how leaving my body is the most comforting thought I can muster, how I keep trying it, leaving. I casket myself into quiet, unfeeling the time the boys at school called me easy, the time the boys on the curb called me bitch. The world keeps calling me girl, a small mind, a smaller voice gaveled by Congress and 45, whose own small hands are still big enough to touch me and get away with it. But such is manhood, a series of getting away with my body, with my boundaries, with my, no. After they came, I didn't shower. No, I thought it too LMN to cry under a showerhead to hot steam my body into feeling anything but dead."
